text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ قَذَفَ رَجُلٌ رَجُلًا مَجُوسِيّاً عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ مَهْ فَقَالَ الرَّجُلُ إِنَّهُ يَنْكِحُ أُمَّهُ أَوْ أُخْتَهُ فَقَالَ ذَلِكَ عِنْدَهُمْ نِكَاحٌ فِي دِينِهِمْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,

‘A man accused a Magian man in the presence of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> so he<sup>asws</sup> said: Muh! (Shh!)’. So the man said, ‘(but) He marries his own mother or his sister’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That is a marriage among them in their Religion’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from ‘ Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “A man once accused a Zoroastrian man before abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, he (the Imam) said, ‘Hold it.’ The man said, ‘He marries his mother or sister.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is marriage among them in their religion.’”
